subject: Re: JUnit doesn't run outside of Visual Age for Java
msgSnippet: Jason, I am running the the com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport on my classpath. It DOES find the DebugSupport. The problem is this: Linkage Error means that
messageBody:
Jason,

I am running the the 'com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport' on my
classpath. It DOES find the DebugSupport. The problem is this:
Linkage Error means that there is another class that DebugSupport is
linked to which it cannot find, because it is native IBM Java class.

If i didn't run 'com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport' in the classpath, it
would simply give me "ClassNotFound" error. However, it throws a
Linkager error: UnsatisfiedLinkError: no uvmtools in
java.library.path.

Thanks,

Lily.



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@f...> wrote:
> On Wed, 2003-06-18 at 17:52, ok_lilya wrote:
>
> > I've been stuck on this problem way too long - There must be
somekind
> > of solution to it! Unless JUnit is designed specifically to avoid
> > being run outside of VAJ. I'm on the verge of giving up.
>
> You need 'com.ibm.uvm.tools.DebugSupport' on your classpath. When
you
> export your code make sure to export the jar with that class as
well.
> JUnit was not written to specifically run in VAJ. So, that isn't
the
> problem!! Look at the JavaDoc for LinkageError, it will give you a
clue
> as to why it is thrown. The JavaDoc probably would have been
sufficient
> to let you know that it was a classpath issue.
>
> =jason
